quotes.quote: Human trafficking is a human tragedy. It's an outrage against any decent people.

Human trafficking is a scourge, a crime against the whole of humanity. It is time to join forces and work together to free its victims and to eradicate this crime that affects all of us, from individual families to the worldwide community.
If we truly want to have world peace, we have to end human trafficking
Excess of liberty, whether it lies in state or individuals, seems only to pass into excess of slavery.
Human trafficking is an open wound on the body of contemporary society, a scourge upon the body of Christ. It is a crime against humanity.
Slavery is a weed that grows on every soil.
Slavery is theft -- theft of a life, theft of work, theft of any property or produce, theft even of the children a slave might have borne.
Defeating Human Trafficking is a great moral calling of our time

Slavery is founded in the selfishness of man's nature - opposition to it, is his love of justice. These principles are an eternal antagonism; and when brought into collision so fiercely, as slavery extension brings them, shocks, and throes, and convulsions must ceaselessly follow.
Human trafficking is a globally assisted pandemic that generates billions of dollars of income a year.

Slavery is a continual and permanent violation of human rights.
